isis.stitle: FAN DRIVE CLUTCH: KYSOR 1090 (8000 SERIES) - DISASSEMBLE

svcproc.title: REMOVE FAN CLUTCH MOUNTED ON FAN HUB ( Figure 7)

calloutgroup.callout1: 1.SOCKET HEAD CAPSCREWS NOT CENTERED IN CLUTCH HOUSING HOLES
2.SOCKET HEAD CAPSCREWS CENTERED IN CLUTCH HOUSING HOLES

step1.para: In many cases it will be necessary to tilt the radiator forward to obtain working room.
Disconnect air lines from the fan clutch.
Remove fan and fan belts. (In some cases the belts may have to be removed to take the fan off.)
Suspend clutch/hub assembly with a sling and remove as a unit. (This is much easier than removing clutch from the hub while the hub is still on the engine.)
Pressurize the clutch so that it will disengage.
Rotate the clutch until holes on the front of the clutch line up with the socket head cap screws that retain the clutch to the hub.
Remove the capscrews and remove the clutch.

note.para: In cases where the radiator can be tilted far enough forward, it is possible to remove the fan, fan clutch and fan hub as one unit which may then be disassembled on the workbench.

svcproc.para: With the fan clutch/hub assembly on a workbench, continue the disassembly.
